page.title: 01Hutton-le-Hole and Gillamoor
page.content: This very beautiful countryside is in the North York Moors National Park. The northern area is mainly heather and moorland. South of this are two valleys,through which,flow the River Dove and Hutton Beck. The high land between them is under cultivation and the valley sides are wooded.Gillamoor, a farming community,stands on the limestone plateau to the west. Hutton- le-Hole,a beautiful village, lies in a small valley.The traditional stone and pantiled cottages are built around a large green common, with white wooden fences divided by the beck. Moorland sheep keep every corner of the green closely cropped the whole year. Late summer sees the moors turn purple as the heather begins to flower. All this makes the area popular with tourists The Ryedale Folk Museum in Hutton-le- Hole also attracts many visitors.
